<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Current announcements will appear here,
at top-level, for quick and easy inspection.</span><span style='font-family:
"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>28July2016: As
posted to the class mailing list, the <span class=SpellE>FinalAI</span>
deadline has been extended to 11:59pm <span class=GramE>Thu.,</span> 28 July;
no submissions accepted after Thu., 28 July.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>27July2016: The
Final Exam key has been posted below, and is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2016-smrq-cs171-old-tests/2016-smq-cs-171-final-exam-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>26
July2016:<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><span style='background:
yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Please bring your UCI ID to the Final Exam today.</span>
We will check your ID when you turn in your Final Exam, just as we did for the Mid-term
Exam. You will need to have your UCI ID to turn in your Final Exam. If you do
not have your UCI ID with you, you will have to go home and get it.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>26July2016: <span
style='background:fuchsia;mso-highlight:fuchsia'>A new <span class=SpellE>StudentResources</span>/
folder <span class=GramE>has</span> been released that corrects an error in the
direction the Java agent initially faces.</span> The agent should and will
start facing to the right. Please fix your code as needed!<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><span style='background:yellow;
mso-highlight:yellow'>Please download and install the new Java and tournament
shells if you are coding in Java.</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>20July2016: The
Quiz #4 key has been posted below and is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2016-smrq-cs171-old-tests/2016-smrq-cs-171-quiz-4-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>19July2016: <span
style='background:fuchsia;mso-highlight:fuchsia'>All <span class=SpellE>FirstGuessAI</span>
and <span class=SpellE>DraftAI</span> deadlines are extended without penalty to
midnight tomorrow, <span class=GramE>Weds.,</span> 20July2016.</span><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You may submit without late penalty any
revised code versions of *either* or *both* your <span class=SpellE>FirstGuessAI</span>
and <span class=SpellE>DraftAI</span> to their respective EEE <span
class=SpellE>DropBox</span> by midnight, tomorrow, Weds. 20July2016. <span
class=GramE>We</span> will run a revised tournament with all of them together,
which will replace all previous results.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>In the end, your code will be evaluated entirely based on your
submission by midnight, tomorrow, Weds. 20July2016, and not on any previous
submission.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>If you wish to correct
a <span class=SpellE>FirstGuessAI</span> submission, please submit it to the
EEE <span class=SpellE>FirstGuessAI</span> <span class=SpellE>DropBox</span>.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>If you wish to correct a <span
class=SpellE>DraftAI</span> submission, please submit it to the <span
class=SpellE>DraftAI</span> <span class=SpellE>DropBox</span>.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please make all desired corrected
submissions to the appropriate desired EEE <span class=SpellE>DropBox</span> by
midnight, tomorrow, Weds. 20July2016<span class=GramE>.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>If</span> you do so, you will avoid any
late penalty.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><span
style='background:fuchsia;mso-highlight:fuchsia'>All late penalties are waived
for <span class=SpellE>FirstGuessAI</span> and for <span class=SpellE>DraftAI</span>,
and submissions will be accepted without penalty until midnight, tomorrow,
Weds. 20July2016.</span> <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>19July2016: <span
style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>New versions of the student
coding shells have been released and are available</span> <a
href="StudentResources.zip">here</a>. Please replace your old shells with these
new shells.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>As always, you may keep
all the “smarts” you have written; simply replace the old shells
with new.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Especially, these new
coding shells fix problems in the tournament shell about which direction the
Java agent begins facing, and they also give the caves used to test <span
class=SpellE>FirstGuessAI</span> and <span class=SpellE>DraftAI</span>
(relevant Worlds for your use may be found in
StudentResources/StudentResources_tournament/Wumpus_World_tournament:
Worlds_20160712, <span class=SpellE>Worlds_DraftAI</span>, and <span
class=SpellE>Worlds_FirstGuessAI</span>.)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>16July2016: <span
style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>As an international courtesy to
international scholars, on Tuesday, 19 July, we will host a group of visitors
from <span class=SpellE>Sookmyung</span> Women's University, South Korea.</span><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>They wish to audit the class that day.
Please plan to attend class on Tuesday, 19 July, in order to show respect and
courtesy from UCI to our international visitors.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>16July2016: <span
style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>*PLEASE* do fill out and submit
your student teaching evaluations for CS-171, Summer Session I.</span> Every
student who fills out a course evaluation from UCI for CS-171 will receive a
bonus of 1% added to their final grade, free and clear, off the curve, simply a
bonus. These evaluations are important to me in improving the CS-171 course
offerings, and to UCI in evaluating our success at our educational mission.
Many of the good features that you now enjoy in CS-171 were suggested by
previous CS-171 students on their student teaching evaluations. I do listen and
respond to what you say.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>16July2016: Our
CS-171 Tournament Director, Abdullah <span class=SpellE>Younis</span>, has
released the results of <span class=SpellE>FirstGuessAI</span>, which are
available <a href="Scoreboard_FirstGuessAI.xlsx">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>16July2016: <span
style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Going forward into the future,
your AI has a time limit of 30 seconds total clock time to explore all 4,000
caves.</span> The reason for this time limit is that all <span class=SpellE>FirstGuessAIs</span>
--- except one --- explored their 4,000 caves in 10 seconds or less.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>That one exceptional AI required what
Abdullah described as "days or weeks."<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>We decided that this outcome was
unreasonable and not OK. Consequently, your AI has a time limit of 30 seconds
to explore all 4,000 caves, which is 3X longer than any <span class=SpellE>FirstGuessAI</span>
(except that outlier) required on all 4,000 caves. We believe this to be a very
generous time limit, which should not affect your code unless you are doing
something truly unusual. Please advise us if you have a legitimate reason to
exceed this 30 second time limit for 4,000 caves.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>14July2016: The
Mid-term Exam key has been posted below and is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2016-smrq-cs171-old-tests/2016-smrq-cs-171-midterm-exam-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>12July2016: The
Quiz #3 key has been posted below and is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2016-smrq-cs171-old-tests/2016-smrq-cs-171-quiz-3-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>12July2016: As
announced to the class mailing list, you may fix your <span class=SpellE>FirstGuessAI</span>
errors or upgrade your code without penalty by depositing a new <span
class=SpellE>AssignmentSubmission</span> in EEE <span class=SpellE>DropBox</span>
by midnight tonight, Tue., 12July.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>12July2016: Dr.
Lathrop’s office hours today will be 4:00-4:30pm due to a conflict.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>9July 2016: <span
style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>No Project submissions will be
accepted later than the Tuesday following each Sunday deadline.</span> (We need
time to run the tournament.) You lose 10% of your project grade on that
assignment for each day or fraction thereof that it is late.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;background:fuchsia;mso-highlight:fuchsia;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>8July2016: <span
style='background:fuchsia;mso-highlight:fuchsia'>Upon the advice of our
Tournament Director, Abdullah <span class=SpellE>Younis</span>, we have changed
the Project grading rubric in your favor:<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-left:1.0in;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level2 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>   </span></span></span><![endif]><b><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>First Guess AI (20% of Project grade): </span></b><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>It must score<b>
>= -200. </b>The purpose of the first guess AI is to get a sense of the code
base in action, make sure everything is working properly, report to students
whose code didn't compile, fix any bugs that arise, and make sure students are
familiar with the submission policies. Setting the pass or fail threshold to <b>-200</b>
tells us that the agent avoids the <span class=SpellE>wumpus</span> and pits a
majority of the time.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-left:1.0in;mso-add-space:
auto'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>Please
note that <b>-200 </b>is deliberately a very low threshold for you. The <span
class=SpellE>emptyAI</span> class that we package with the java and <span
class=SpellE>cpp</span> shells only climbs, so it always scores -1. This class
will beat all three <span class=SpellE>RandomAIs</span>. Sometimes, it even
beats a <span class=SpellE>PoorAI</span>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-left:1.0in;mso-add-space:
auto'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span><span
style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>You are not allowed to turn in <span
class=SpellE>emptyAI</span> (or any other agent that only climbs) as your <span
class=SpellE>FirstGuessAI</span>.</span><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>(We already have <span class=SpellE>emptyAI</span>, so if that was what
we wanted, we could just turn it in to ourselves.) You must do something at
least slightly more interesting and creative.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-left:1.0in;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level2 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>   </span></span></span><![endif]><b><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>Draft AI (30% of Project grade): </span></b><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>It must score <b>positive
(> 0)</b>. There is a major difference between scores of -1 and 1. To score
a positive value, the agent must successful capture the gold a few times out of
4000 caves, and must have some sort of record keeping to achieve this. This is
a big threshold in the sense that it guarantees the agent has some 'smarts'.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-left:1.0in;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level2 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>   </span></span></span><![endif]><b><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>Final AI (50% of Project grade; Write-up
15%, AI 35%):</span></b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> It must score <b>>= 200</b>. This says that
the agent is now able to retrieve the gold better than one out of five times
and rarely die.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>With this scale, it is clear what is expected of the
students. The First Guess should avoid dying and do something slightly
interesting. The Draft AI should start to be aware of the board and start
record keeping. The Final AI should capture the gold more than 20% of the time
and rarely die.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>8July2016:
<span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>A new java shell has been
released that fixes the bug whereby the agent starts facing down.</span> It is
available in the Project section below and also here. Please discard old java
shells and download the new one. As always, you can keep any
“smart” code you have written, just put it in the new shell.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>5July2016: As promised in lecture, new project shell
versions have been released by the student developers. Please download them,
and then discard your old shells. You can keep any “smart” code you
have written, just put it into the new shells.</span><span style='font-family:
"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><span
style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Also, be sure to download and
read the updated documentation and background info.</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level2 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span

mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>3July2016: <b><u>Good

(currently) Friday to (<b><u>changed to</u></b>) Sunday. The main reason f this
change is to give you more time to code.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>You will have a whole additional weekend to write code.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

“smart” code you have written, just put it into the new shells.</span><span

"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>We will fix any further problems and issue new shells as necessary.
Please watch for and download any new shells, then discard your old shells. You

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>To
help you get started, we also have released the source code to “<span
class=SpellE>RandomAI</span>,” and the executables to <span class=SpellE>RandomAI</span>,
<span class=SpellE>PoorAI</span>, <span class=SpellE>AverageAI</span>, and <span
class=SpellE>GoodAI</span> (they go by different names in different shells).
(Only the Java shell has a propositional logic theorem prover now. The C++
shell has 1,000 random caves for each of 4x4 through 7x7.)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpFirst style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>29Jun2016:
At 1pm on Tue., 5 July, we will have a brief Special Guest Presentation by
Teresa Barrett-<span class=SpellE>Bewley</span> of the UC Irvine Blood Donor
Center. Please try to arrive early so that you do not miss her presentation.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>29Jun2016:
The CS-171 Teaching Staff office hours have been fixed and are in effect now as
follows:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u>Yue Yu<o:p></o:p></u></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Office
hours: Wednesday 3:00-4:00pm, or anytime by appointment, in Calit2 room 3301 (<span
class=GramE>building<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>325</span> on
the <a
href="https://communications.uci.edu/documents/pdf/UCI_15_map_campus_core.pdf">UCI
campus map</a>, directly adjacent to DBH).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u>Abdullah <span class=SpellE>Younis</span><o:p></o:p></u></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Office
hours: Tuesday noon-12:45pm in DBH room 3013. This time will be a
“Project Clinic” where you can get answers to project questions and
help with project problems.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Email:
younisa@uci.edu<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u>Richard Lathrop<o:p></o:p></u></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Office
hours: Tuesday 4:00-5:00pm, or anytime by appointment, in DBH room 4224.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Email:
rickl@uci.edu<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u>**** (If you send email, please put
“CS-171” somewhere in the Subject line.) ****<o:p></o:p></u></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>These
office hours are made available to you in order to help you understand the
material and get a better grade, so please do take advantage of them.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>28Jun2016:
The Quiz #1 key has been posted below and is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2016-smrq-cs171-old-tests/2016-smrq-cs-171-quiz-1-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>28Jun2016:
<span style='background:fuchsia;mso-highlight:fuchsia'>We are fixing a newly-discovered
problem with the project Python subdirectory, and so the project link has been
removed until it is fixed (hoped for later tonight).</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>28Jun2016:
Abdullah <span class=SpellE>Younis</span>, the Project Tournament Director, has
kindly agreed to hold a “Project Clinic” noon-12:45pm each Tuesday
in DBH-3013, starting next Tuesday, 5 July. He will help you solve any problems
you may encounter with your project.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>28Jun2016:
</span><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;background:fuchsia;
mso-highlight:fuchsia'>New shells have been released and are available here and
in the Project section below.</span></b><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>
These new shells should fix many of the problems you have encountered, and also
be more compatible with the tournament. <span style='background:yellow;
mso-highlight:yellow'>Please discard your old shells.</span> You can keep any
“smart” code you have written, just put it in the new shells.</span></b><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>26Jun2016:
Due to the fact that the coding project shells are almost but not quite yet
ready, we have changed the project due date deadlines to be more favorable to
you. <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style='background:yellow;
mso-highlight:yellow'>Every previous Tuesday due date is hereby changed to
Friday of that same week.</span></u></b> This change will give you three more
days to code your project for the deadline, and will avoid having both a test
and a project deadline due on the same day<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>24Jun2016:
As was announced repeatedly in lecture and as appears below, Discussion Section
is <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u>mandatory</u></b>. In particular,
it is <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u>NOT OK</u></b> to be present
for roll call and then leave in the middle of the Discussion Section lecture.
If necessary, we will call roll immediately thereafter to identify such a
student, who will thereupon lose points. <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u>I
hope it does not come to this. I hope and expect that students in this class
will show respect and courtesy to the TAs who <span class=GramE>are</span>
leading the Discussion Section lectures.</u></b><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>Your
TAs <span class=GramE>are</span> there only for your benefit, to help you
understand the material better and thereby achieve a higher grade. Their
experience as TAs is an important part of the UCI educational mission, as part
of their training to become future teachers and professors. I will not allow
you to interfere with them in achieving the goals of their educational mission.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>In
particular, please drink your water, use the bathroom, and answer your cell
phone during the break or after Discussion Section. <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><u>You are not allowed to leave Discussion Section for any reason after
roll has been called and before the break.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>You will lose points if you do so.<o:p></o:p></u></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>23Jun2016:
Abdullah <span class=SpellE>Younis</span>, the Project Tournament Director, has
agreed to attend the beginning of class each Tuesday to answer questions about
the project, the shells, and the tournament. Please accumulate your questions
and bring them for him each Tuesday. Also, if you send me email about these
topics, please CC Abdullah (</span><a
href="mailto:younisa@uci.edu?subject=CS-171:%20%20%7bPlease%20edit%20subject%20to%20fit%7d">younisa@uci.edu</a>).<span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>23Jun2016:
If you are a wait-listed student who wishes to add the class, please see Dr.
Lathrop at the podium immediately after lecture. Students will be added in
wait-list order up to the course capacity.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>23Jun2016:
There is now a CS-171 <span class=SpellE>MessageBoard</span> on EEE with two
Forums for your use. “CS-171, Intro to AI, Summer Session I, 2016”<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>    </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>CS-171 Course Material Discussion:</b> This forum is available for
students to discuss aspects of the CS-171 course material. Normal forum •
Posters identified • No password required<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>    </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>CS-171 Coding Projects Discussion:</b> This forum is available for
CS-171 students to discuss various aspects of the coding projects as they go
along and reflect upon how, actually, to do it. Normal forum • Identities
may be suppressed • No password required<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>21Jun2016:
Although this class website is only complete through the first week of classes,
I have decided to release it to EEE now anyway in hopes that it will be useful
to you for planning purposes. The coding shells will be added tomorrow
(22Jun2016), and I will expand the later weeks shortly.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpLast style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>21Jun2016:
Please see class email dated 21Jun2016 about a REALLY EXCITING experiment being
done here at ICS as an Internet of Things study with Google Glass during this
summer. You all should respond eagerly and enthusiastically to this
request.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You will be provided with
a Google Glass device and will use it while walking around campus.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>(How exciting is that?) You will receive
"alerts" about <span class=SpellE>IoT</span>-related scenarios from
the device, answer several questions for each, and perform an exit survey. This
is a great opportunity to try a hot new technology (Google Glass) in an
important upcoming area (<span class=SpellE>IoT</span>) while advancing
computer science research here at ICS. Contact <span class=SpellE>Hosub</span>
Lee <a href="mailto:hosubl@uci.edu">hosubl@uci.edu</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p> </o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span

Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:

</span></span></span><![endif]><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Sun.,

<h2><a name="_Goal:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Goal:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:black'>The goal of this class is to familiarize you with the basic
principles of artificial intelligence. You will l</span><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>earn <span style='color:black'>some
</span>basic AI techniques, the problems for which they are applicable, and
their limitations.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course content is organized roughly around what are often considered to be
three central pillars of AI: Search, Logic, and Learning. Topics covered
include basic search, heuristic search, game search, constraint satisfaction,
knowledge representation, logic and inference, probabilistic modeling, and
machine learning algorithms. <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<h2><a name="_Class_Setup:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Class Setup:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course will be primarily lecture-based.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>There will be a Mid-term and a Final Exam.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>On all Tuesdays after the first one, the
first 20 minutes will be an in-class pop quiz, followed by lecture (see
specific dates in <a href="#_Important_Dates:">Important Dates</a> above).<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The frequent quizzes are intended to
encourage you to stay current with the course material.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><u>All exams and quizzes may cover all
material presented in class, including lectures and assigned textbook reading.</u><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Quizzes will cover mostly material
presented since the last quiz, and also may include questions that many
students missed on the previous quiz.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>The Final Exam will cover mostly material since the Mid-term Exam, and
also will include many questions intended to encourage you to remember the
earlier material (i.e., it <u>will </u>be comprehensive). <u>Please study the
previous CS-171 quizzes and exams (<a href="#_Study_Guides_---">below</a>),
which are made available as study guides to help you learn and master the class
material; they are important guides about the performance that will be expected
from you now.</u><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>There
will be an AI coding project (see <a href="#_Projects:">Project section</a>
below).<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>This is an individual
project, i.e., you must do it entirely by yourself.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please note that you are encouraged to
discuss concepts, methods, algorithms, etc.; but you are forbidden to copy: (1)
source code from any source, or (2) text from any source unless properly cited
and set off as a quote.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Except for
class materials provided from this class website, you must invent and write all
of your own code by yourself.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Except for properly referenced material, you must write all of your own
project report by yourself. <span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Please
note that your source code and project report are subject to analysis by
automated plagiarism detection programs, and that direct copying will be
treated as an act of academic dishonesty (please see the section on “<a
href="#_Academic_Honesty:">Academic Honesty</a>” below). Please start
your AI coding project earlier than you believe necessary, i.e., immediately;
it will take longer and be more difficult than you expect </span><span
style='background:red;mso-highlight:red'>(<u>as is true of all coding projects
everywhere at all times</u>).</span><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>All
my AI project shells were written by former CS-171 students who became interested
in AI and signed up for CS-199 in order to pursue their interest and write more
interesting AI project shells.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Please let me know if this is of interest to you (CS-171 grade of A- or
better required).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Homework
will be assigned, but is not graded. The reason is that prior student course
evaluations alerted me to the existence of student cheating by way of copying
the homework answers.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I deplore
this degree of personal degradation in dishonest students, but I cannot control
it, and so I avoid the opportunity.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>I remain determined to create a fair and honest educational experience
for all students, as best I can.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=left>

</span></h2>

<h2><a name="_Textbook"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Textbook</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:red'>Required:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><a
href="http://aima.cs.berkeley.edu/">Russell & <span class=SpellE><span
class=GramE>Norvig</span></span><span class=GramE> :</span> Artificial
Intelligence; A Modern Approach, 3<sup>rd</sup> edition.</a><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>The
course is based on, and the UCI bookstore has, the 3<sup>rd</sup> edition. The
assigned textbook reading is required, and is fair game for quizzes and
exams.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>You
place yourself at a distinct disadvantage if you do not have the textbook.</span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I expect that you have a personal copy
of the textbook, and quizzes and exams are written accordingly.</span></b><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Please
purchase or rent your own personal textbook for the quarter (and then resell it
back to the UCI Bookstore at the end if you don't want it for reference).</span>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style='color:red'>Please do not
jeopardize your precious educational experience with the false economy of
trying to save a few dollars by not having a personal copy of the textbook.</span></u></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Also,
for your convenience, I have requested that a copy of the textbook be placed on
reserve in the UCI Science Library.</span><strong><span style='font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> There is a two-hour check-out limit. </span></strong>However,
please understand that with high student enrollments, it is unrealistic to
expect that these thin reserves always will be available when you need
them.  <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style='color:red'>Please
purchase or rent your own personal textbook. Otherwise, you are at a severe
disadvantage.</span></u></b><strong><span style='color:red;font-weight:normal;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<p><strong><span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow;font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>I do deplore the high cost of modern textbooks.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You may find the textbook cheaper if you
look online at sites such as eBay.com, Amazon.com, etc.; or search the web for other
sites related to the textbook.<o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<p><strong><span style='font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>You may
find the following sites useful, though I cannot vouch for them:<o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<p><strong><span style='font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span><o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><a name="_Grading:"></a><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Grading:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Your grade will be based on
Discussion Section participation (10%)</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>, a
coding project (20%)</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>, the four </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>quizzes
(20%), a mid-term exam (25%), and a final exam (25%).</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'> Homework is
assigned but ungraded.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo6'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Discussion Section is
REQUIRED and roll will be taken each period (10 periods = 2 periods per week
over five weeks).</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'> Participation means asking a question or making a comment,
not just sitting silently in your seat. Each of the 10 periods counts as 1/10
of the 10% Discussion Section Participation points.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo6'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>The AI coding project
will be a “<span class=SpellE>Wumpus</span> World” AI agent.</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>“<span class=SpellE>Wumpus</span>
World” is exactly as described in your textbook (pp. 236-240, 246-247,
305-307, <span class=GramE>499</span>-503), except that we allow the square
cave to be of variable and unknown size, 4x4 to 7x7.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>“Dumb” coding shells are
available in C++, Java, and Python.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>You must write the “smarts.” Your final AI will compete in a
tournament against all your classmates for extra credit bonus points. This is a
solo project and you must do all of it all by yourself.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span><span
style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Your “First Guess”
AI is due 10 July (20% of Project), your “Draft AI” is due 17 July
(30% of Project), and your “Final AI” is due 24 July (50% of
Project; 15% Write-up, 35% AI).</span><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span><u>You are already behind schedule.</u><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Start coding now.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>More details below in the Project
section.</span> <span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>You will lose 10% of your Project grade
for every day or fraction thereof it is late.</span><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>Your
“Final AI” will be entered into a tournament against all of your
classmate’s AIs. All will be run against the same 4,000 random caves and
scored as described in your textbook. The average score-per-cave will be used
to rank all student AIs. The top 10% will have their Project score increased by
10% (= 2% of total grade), the second 10% by 9%, the third 10% by 8%, and so
on.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo6'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Quizzes will be given
the first 20 minutes of class every Tuesday following the first one </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>(dates are
listed in <a href="#_Important_Dates:">Important Dates</a> above), and are
closed-book, closed-notes.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Your
lowest quiz score will be discarded in computing your grade.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><u>It is not possible to make-up missed
quizzes, but one missed quiz may be discarded as your lowest quiz score.</u><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo6'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>The mid-term exam
will be given in class on Thursday, 7 July,</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'> and is closed-book,
closed-notes.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><u>It is not possible
to make-up a missed mid-term exam.<o:p></o:p></u></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo6'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>The final exam will
be given in class on Tuesday, 26 July,</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'> and is closed-book,
closed-notes.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The final exam will
cover <u>all course material from the entire quarter</u>, with emphasis on the
second half.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><u>It is not possible
to make-up a missed final exam.</u><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>I make exceptions for:<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>*
<span class=GramE>genuine</span> medical conditions (<u>I require a signed note
from your doctor on official letterhead</u>),<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>*
<span class=GramE>births/deaths</span> in the family (<u>I require a copy of
the birth/death certificate</u>),<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>*
<span class=GramE>jury</span> duty or other court proceedings (<u>I require a
copy of your jury service papers or other official court documents</u>), or<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>*
field maneuvers of the US military or National Guard (<u>I require a copy of
your official orders</u>).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Also, I honor all requests made by the <a
href="http://www.disability.uci.edu/">UCI Disability Services Center</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo7'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><u><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Every student who fills out a course evaluation
for CS-171 will receive a bonus of 1% added to their final grade, free and
clear, off the curve, simply a bonus.</span></u><u><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></u></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>        </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>EEE will
return to me the names of students who fill out evaluations (but not the
content, which remains anonymous), provided that enough students fill out
evaluations so that anonymity is not compromised.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I will add 1% free bonus to the final
grade of each such named student.</span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>        </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Student
course evaluations are very important to me for monitoring and improving the
course content, and very important to UCI for evaluating our success at our
educational mission.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>*Please* fill
out your student course evaluations.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo7'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>“Bonus
Points”</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>
will be awarded, at my sole discretion, (1) to the first student who spots <span
style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>a genuine technical error</span>
(minor typos don’t count) in any of the course materials before I spot it
too, and (2) <span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>for helpful
contributions</span> to the class as we go along.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>One bonus point is equivalent to one
quiz point.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Your Bonus Points, if any, should be visible to you in EEE <span
class=SpellE>GradeBook</span>. If for some reason you have been awarded a Bonus
Point, but you did not get a notification from me or it did not appear in EEE <span
class=SpellE>GradeBook</span>, please do not hesitate to send an email message
to me as a reminder.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><a name="_Study_Habits:"></a><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Study Habits:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>This course is technical, rigorous,
and demanding. You will be expected to learn and master a large body of
technical material in a very short period of time. You must demonstrate your
mastery by (1) accurate performance on frequent quizzes and exams, and (2)
successful implementation of an AI coding project.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>I
deliberately treat you as adults who are responsible for your own educational
decisions, and so Lecture is optional. <span style='background:yellow;
mso-highlight:yellow'>Discussion Section is required and roll will be taken,</span>
because it is part of our educational mission to train our TAs to become future
professors. Nevertheless, students who do not attend Lecture are at a serious
disadvantage and do not succeed as well in this class.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Students who spend Lectures and
Discussion Section sleeping, on cell phones, surfing the Web, or on social
media are wasting their time and might as well be absent.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Such students send me email messages to
ask questions that already were covered thoroughly and in detail during Lecture
and once again in Discussion Section.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>On quizzes and exams, they miss points that already have been covered
thoroughly.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><u><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Your
educational moments are precious, and your education now will be the single
most important factor in your future career success or failure.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please, make the most of your precious
educational moments now. Please, attend both Lecture and Discussion Section,
pay attention, ask questions, and master the material.</span></u><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Please
do not ever fall behind in the class material; instead, <u>study frequently and
diligently</u>. Please begin your AI coding project earlier than you believe
necessary; it will take longer and be more difficult than you expect (<u>as is
true of all coding projects everywhere at all times</u>).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Please
work harder and study longer.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Please understand thoroughly all class material, and ask questions when
you do not understand.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please
attend all lectures and discussion sections.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please come to lectures and discussion
sections prepared with questions about any material that is not clear.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please do all assigned reading, both
before and again after lecture. Please review the lecture notes, several times
over, both before and again after lecture, until you understand every detail.
Please regularly attend office hours with me and the TA. Please ask questions
about any class material that is not absolutely crystal clear.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Please
<u>work and understand all past quizzes and exams; they are important guides
about the performance that will be expected from you now.</u> Please work and
understand all the optional homework.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Please
<u>OVERSTUDY!!</u><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><span
style='mso-tab-count:2'>                        </span></span><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>“<a
href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Technological_singularity">Technological
singularity</a>” --- Wikipedia.</span></span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-1.5in'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>                                    </span>“The
technological singularity hypothesis is that accelerating progress in
technologies will cause a runaway effect wherein artificial intelligence will
exceed human intellectual capacity and control, thus radically changing or even
ending civilization in an event called the singularity.”<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:2'>                        </span><span
class=GramE>“<a
href="http://www-rohan.sdsu.edu/faculty/vinge/misc/singularity.html">The Coming
Technological Singularity: How to Survive in the Post-Human Era</a>” (c)
1993 by <span class=SpellE>Vernor</span> <span class=SpellE>Vinge</span>.</span><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:3'>                                    </span>(Verbatim
copying/translation and distribution of this entire article <span class=GramE>is</span>
permitted in any medium, provided this notice is preserved.)<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>    </span><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-1.5in'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:2'>                                                </span>“Abstract:<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>     </span>Within thirty years,
we will have the technological means to create superhuman intelligence. Shortly
after, the human era will be ended.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Is such progress avoidable? If not to be avoided, can events be guided
so that we may survive?<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>These
questions are investigated. Some possible answers (and some further dangers)
are presented.”<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-1.5in'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:2'>                                                </span>“....
Just so I'm not guilty of a relative-time ambiguity, let me more specific: I'll
be surprised if this event occurs before 2005 or after 2030....”<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>;-)<a name="_Week_2:"></a><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

</span><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>Eric

passes closest to Europa, maximizing the velocity before the insertion sequence

optimal behavior, as opposed to immediately reducing its energy as a Greedy
Best First algorithm using this heuristic would want to do.” <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:
3'>                                    </span>The
program learns to build a car using a genetic algorithm.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:
3'>                                    </span>If
you let this program run for a long time (>> 30 generations), you will
see that eventually it produces cars well suited to the terrain. This outcome
illustrates a general theme of genetic algorithms: very, very slow; but,
eventually, good performance. After all, it took ~3.6 billion years to evolve
humans from bacteria (<a
href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timeline_of_evolutionary_history_of_life">http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timeline_of_evolutionary_history_of_life</a>).
Please note that this eventual good performance of genetic algorithms is
conditional upon a representation that allows good solutions to sub-problems to
be combined simply, by cross-over, into a globally good solution; if the vector
position of the features is completely randomized within the chromosome, any
such good performance is lost.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
